ygData.subject: SV: Re: lore items
ygData.msgSnippet: Whats this crap about player economy ? Go to Veeshan and visit Freeport on a crowded night and you wont find 2 ppl of 10 that want to sell there stuff, only
ygData.messageBody:
Whats this crap about player economy ? Go to Veeshan and visit Freeport on a crowded night and you wont find 2 ppl of 10 that want to sell there stuff, only trading. Money is worthles in EQ at higher level. Well some ppl say you can invest it in a tradde skill, why the hell should I ?? the only trade skill worth the effort is jewelery and then you still only get more worthles money.



/Askur lv 25 Wizard on Veeshan

----- Original Message -----
From: Lim Dul <sevendegrees@...>
To: <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Sent: Monday, September 13, 1999 8:39 PM
Subject: [eq_wizards] Re: lore items


> From: "Lim Dul" <sevendegrees@...>
>
> Message: 9
> Date: Fri, 10 Sep 1999 18:53:02 EDT
> From: SPRUSBRUCE@...
> Subject: Re: Re: lore items
>
> >NO NO NO....it would be pointless you want items rare it will make economy
> >better if you get it all the time that would suck so much and you wouldnt
> >like it beilive me
>
> I don't see it my friend. Making everyone sit for hours at end for an item
> seems like the wrong approach if all they want to do is drive up the
> economy. I know this isn't a single-player game, but it's based on the same
> model....I'd be pissed off as hell if I killed a level boss only to find out
> it didn't carry what I wanted and I got nothing out of it.
>
> Can you give me an example of how I wouldn't like it? ;)
>
> -- Lim'Dul
>
